intro: Ortholoma acuminatum, commonly known as the slender ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Ortholoma acuminatum is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern California.
